title: Anime NFT game - gap in the market
description: Chinese public cannot realise the utility of cryptocurrency they bought due to crackdown, this can be realised by using an NFT game model.

f6_assessments.q0: Play to earn games are a way of live for many and can bring value to the Cardano ecosystem. I would like to see how NFTs are used in the project beyond the sale of NFTs to fund the project. I would like to see the problem statement and solution clarified, at the moment they seem in conflict, as I understand the problem is that Chinese wallets can spend or move crypto, how will they be able to participate then?
f6_assessments.q1: Gamifying NFTs for play to earn is a good idea. However, the project requires further elaboration. I would like to see links to LinkedIn, Github or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about the team work history, education and past experiences. The team can expand on the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed". Lastly, I would like to see references to facts claimed by the project example: Asia has more crypto ownership than all other continents combined.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided a roadmap, KPIs, and definition of success by milestones. I would like to see the KPIs expanded, at current moment the KPIs are milestone/roadmap items, I would like to see the team create KPIs such as: "number of NFT's created by x, number (value) of NFTs sold by y, etc). The budget is a five-line item at the moment, I would like to see the budget broken down into monthly spending and allocation to activity for the month. As the project stands at the moment I am neutral on the audibility of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: Brilliant idea that has identified a very topical problem and formulated a potential solution. The risk factor may be high although reading through the proposers comments it would appear that he has good knowledge to match his idea. There remains a number of questions that cannot be assessed that are political and legal in nature so to some extent this project will have to be taken on trust.
f6_assessments.q1: Experience appears valid but nil bio or links to previous work, github or website so impossible to authenticate. Reading the proposal and the comments section gives us some insight that the proposer has excellent experience and knowledge pertinent to this sector but cannot validate. The plan is detailed and does not seem too outlandish but again cannot be reviewed sufficiently to back the proposers claims. Work may well have started and illustrations drawn but I cannot find anything to know this is the case. This is a real shame because I sense a good idea from a clever IT professional.  I would highly recommend that the proposer establish further collaborations with the Catalyst community, find a way to share small samples of the work already completed and resubmit in future fund.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided in the proposal only allows for the validation of a great topical idea that potentially could add much value to the Cardano ecosystem. Seems to be an enthusiastic proposer whom has already completed much of the required research and planning at least but very little can be verified and that poses a risk for the Catalyst community in terms of outcomes and deliverables. The metrics/KPI's appear reasonable although the timeline is optimistic unless much of the work is already done. Making a game that will onboard users is a highly competitive market to enter albeit this one is designed for a target audience whom may be thrilled with the idea of utilising their cryptocurrency in a safe legal manner which CCP authorities will allow. I feel the Catalyst community will need strong evidence to clarify that this project will not have a negative outcome for all parties involved.

f6_assessments.q0: Has the potential to increase usage of NFTs in China.
f6_assessments.q1: The team seems to have limited experience with game development, although it is noted he is a game enthusiast.   The budget doesn't include much for game development.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones are well described and should be adequate for tracking the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has a specific use case but according to the information provided it looks like it's focused on the Chinese public who are stuck with the cryptocurrency they bought. Which seems like a model that will not last. If the audience group is wider than a very specific audience. This challenge will be more sensible.
f6_assessments.q1: To follow up on the notes in "The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.". I'm doubtful of the plan, depends a lot of on the game concept. The experience of the proposer is reasonable but requires some assistant to accomplish the goal.
f6_assessments.q2: The timeline provided seems like a very short sprint for building a game. The proposal can provide more information about the game. If the game is in 3D like bigtime.gg it will require more time or more resources to successfully implement what is suggested.

solution: We can utilise one of Chinese's most popular game genres to stimulate the spending and adoption of Cardano by creating a F2P NFT game.
experience: 4 years in Project Management, vast resource connection in IT. As an South-East Asian, and a gaming enthusiast, I know Asian game appetites.
